dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 1532 IH: To authorize any Indian Tribe to lease, sell, convey, warrant, or otherwise transfer real property to which that Indian Tribe holds fee title without the consent of the Federal Government, and for other purposes.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Hageman introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources

form.official-title: To authorize any Indian Tribe to lease, sell, convey, warrant, or otherwise transfer real property to which that Indian Tribe holds fee title without the consent of the Federal Government, and for other purposes.

section.header: Federal consent not required for real property transactions by Indian Tribes

subsection.text: Notwithstanding section 12 of the Act of June 30, 1834 (25 U.S.C. 177; 4 Stat. 730), an Indian Tribe may lease, sell, convey, warrant, or otherwise transfer, in whole or in part, any real property and any interest in any real property to which the Indian Tribe holds fee title without the consent of the Federal Government.

paragraph.text: authorizes an Indian Tribe to lease, sell, convey, warrant, or otherwise transfer, in whole or in part, any real property or any interest in any real property that is held in trust by the United States for the benefit of an Indian Tribe; or

affects the operation of any law governing leasing, selling, conveying, warranting, or otherwise transferring any interest in any real property that is held in trust by the United States for the benefit of an Indian Tribe.

subsection.text: For the purposes of this section, the term Indian Tribe has the meaning given the term Indian tribe in section 102 of the Federally Recognized Indian Tribe List Act of 1994 (25 U.S.C. 5130).
